availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, farmer. New Jersey native. Married to Elizabeth Straight Stull in Clermont County, Ohio, on May 4, 1827. Father of Mary Stull, Theodore Stull, Amanda Stull, Hortense Stull, and Milton A. Stull. Farmer in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Campbell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, District 2, p. 116B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, p. 912.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, Elk Fork Precinct, p. 436A.
Ohio, U.S., County Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Clermont County Courthouse, Batavia, Ohio, Clermont County Marriages, 1814-1845, Film #000327560, p. 108 of 466 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
